Community Hub
Card Hunter
Shuffle your cards and ready your dice - Card Hunter is a fresh new card gaming spin on classic tabletop RPGs. Battle your way through a massive campaign solo or with friends and compete with other players in ranked play and tournaments.
User reviews: Very Positive (1,815 reviews) - 86% of the 1,815 user reviews for this game are positive.
Release Date: Jul 13, 2015

Recent updates View all (30)

October 24

Server down for maintenance (24 Oct 19:20 GMT)

As you may have noticed, we've been having some server instability since the last release. We're currently rolling back the changes that may be behind that which will take around an hour (hopefully a bit less). Sorry for the inconvenience.

3 comments Read more

October 21

Release 3.85 (22 Oct)

This build contains a few critical Halloween fixes, like ensuring that Candy Nauticorn is available in the Halloween store. It also contains some more minor stuff like a fix to a bug that was potentially causing the server to crash (runaway battle logic when getting Mind Mulched too much).

Adventures

  • Fix loot algorithm for any level adventures with guaranteed rarity. Ensures club loot should be the right rarity in Caverns of Chaos.
Boards
  • Fixed board bug on Caverns of Chaos throne room
Achievements
  • Add a promotional tag to Halloween items to exclude them from item counting for steam stat purposes.
Modules
  • Fixed typo on Gnome Lords cover.
Halloween
  • Candy Nauticorn is back in stock in the Halloween store!
Cards
  • Clamp group hand retain amount to a minimum of zero (fixes two or more Mind Mulches causing hand size to be reduced below zero).
Battle
  • Limit command queueing between user instructions to prevent runaway battles.
  • Add a new null command to catch resigns, etc if the command queue gets truncated.

1 comments Read more

About This Game

Welcome, bold adventurer! Card Hunter is an online collectible card game which blends together card play, deck building, tactical combat and fantasy role-playing in a way you've never seen before. Grab your cards, miniatures, dice and snacks, then journey to a new world of adventure on the tabletop of your Game Master, Gary.

Build your party and set forth on a grand adventure in the massive single-player campaign. Each adventure will challenge your deck-building skills and tactical prowess as you battle horrifying Black Oozes, savage War Monkeys and more.

Amass a collection of fantastical swords, shields and other adventuring gear. In Card Hunter's unique deck building system, equipping your party with these items builds your deck for you.

Enter the fray on a grid based battlefield. Prepare for turn-based strategy where you must play your cards right to defeat your foes and be rewarded with experience and loot.

When you’re ready, challenge other players in casual games, ranked matches or regularly scheduled leagues. Can you rise to the top of this month’s season? Can you and your undead minions triumph in the Graveyard Gambol league? Multiplayer Card Hunter is a never-ending challenge.

Don't want to face the monsters alone? Adventure co-operatively with one or two friends and share the dangers of Cardhuntria as well as the rewards.

When you're done with the huge core campaign, get ready for when robots and insane computers invade in the all new Expedition to the Sky Citadel set. Or, if you prefer your monsters from the murky mists of time, brave the challenge of prehistoric monsters and intelligent weapons in the fiendish Attack of the Artifacts .
READ MORE

Africandave

17 reviews
Recommended
55.6 hrs on record
Posted: July 19
For people who are socially isolated enough to want to play D&D, but don't have any real-life friends.

Amazing turn based combat, classic rpg elements, and the "board-game" art style is awesome.
CO-OP campaign (3 players one char each) is SUPER fun. You will be laughed at.
Only transactions are cosmetic, so no getting blown out the water in PVP when you go against a wallet warrior.

SkyRaider
123 products in account
9 reviews
Recommended
19.5 hrs on record
Posted: July 26
If Magic : The Gathering and Dungeons & Dragons have a child, Card Hunter would be it.

At its core, Card Hunter is a pen and paper RPG with a twist. You play all of your action through cards that obtained from equiping items. So, different items had different cards.

Pro :
1. Free to play with cash to speedup your progress.
2. Excellent Multiplayer with automatic matchmaking, ladder, rewards, etc.
3. Easy to learn, hard to master.
4. Excellent Singleplayer/Coop campaign.

Con :
1. Currently only 3 class and 3 races. Based on D&D mechanic, this is rather small
2. There is no way to gain cash currency for free other than joining guild (Five 5$ redeemable coupon that only guild master decide who gonna get it). You only get what they give it to you while doing tutorial (spend it wisely).
3. Some dungeon are locked with cash currency. While there is no item that cannot be obtained by free players, the locked dungeon guaranteed to get an epic item for the first time completed.

Some tips :
1. Choose your starting party wisely. While you can change it anytime you want, it can be a hassle to level up it again. A popular combination is dwarf warrior, human priest, and elf wizard but I dont recommend it (see tips 2). My personal favourite is elf warrior, human priest and gnome wizard that kinda hard early on. Check the wiki for some insight. http://wiki.cardhuntria.com/wiki/Cardhuntria:Community_portal
2. You get a free multiplayer pack at Renown 5. Try to raise your renown to that level by doing campaign first. The pack is consist of dwarf warior, human priest and elf wizard with reasonable equipment to get you started multiplayer. Multiplayer character is interchangeable with the campaign character, that is why I suggest not to take that character as your starting character because you get it free later. But, recruiting level 1 character is only 10 gold. So do what you seem it fit.
3. A lot of people is asking this, so I gonna write it here. You can start selling your equipment at Renown 7. I dont recommend to sell equipment because you maybe need it sometimes later for the campaign.
4. When you get your pizza, the game make you spend it at that time. Just dont ! Close the client and you get the pizza without spending it. You can spend it later for whatever seems the best for you.
Read More

Card Hunter was a browser-based game that uses digital cards and a board to simulate a role-playing experience. But this isn't just an adventure game with orcs, warriors, and a kingdom to save! you're literally playing a Dungeons and Dragons game with a modern day story and it's now on STEAM with Multiplayer and also FREE! not PAY to WIN. Which make the game one of the best there is on steam right now, either you're new to this genre or not you will fall in love with this game like we all have back in 2013!

Posted: July 13
One of the few free-to-play games I have played that actually I felt earned my money. After playing for a few hours I spent some cash not because I needed it to get better items but that I felt the game developers deserved to be paid for making a solid game.

Not the shiniest or prettiest game out there but the gameplay is very solid.

Midnighter
1,635 products in account
11 reviews
Recommended
290.1 hrs on record
Posted: August 4
I strongly recommend this free game, it's a high quality cards/strategy game with some RPG elements that offers a lot of content for free.

It's not pay to win, you can pay to get some extra stuff like costumes, more challenges or some loot when you open chests but it doesn't give you any advantage against other players (well, you might collect some useful items a bit faster, that's all). I decided to pay (I got the Basic Edition) after 30 hours of gameplay and not because I need it but because I feel the developers really deserve it for this awesome game and I think I'll keep playing it for many more hours.

Besides the long solo campaign it offers a great multiplayer experience with a simple but effective automatic matching system and a rating that gets updated after each battle. There are also leagues with different game modes.

All in all, a fantastic free game that shouldn't go without notice.
Read More
